speaker: BILLY
line: Mom! Watch me!

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Okay, Billy!

speaker: BILLY
line: Mom! You're not watching!

speaker: BILLY
line: Mom!

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Billy?! Billy?

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Billy! Billy!

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Billy! Billy! Billy!

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: My little boy... My Billy... Billy! Billy!

speaker: JOSH
line: Mom!

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Hi. Josh. I was just coming in. They know you're supposed to wait.

speaker: JOSH
line: They're looking for you.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Who? Who's looking for me? Hey, what is it?

speaker: JOSH
line: Go look, Mom.

speaker: PRINCIPAL
line: Mrs. Underwood, we tried to call you. You must've already left.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: What is everyone staring at? What is going on?

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Oh... Billy?

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: My beautiful boy. Billy? Oh... Oh... Oh...

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Oh, Billy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm just going to shine this light in your eyes, okay? You're doing great. See? Nothing to it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He won't speak?

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: No, not even to his parents.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Are they here, his parents?

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: Oh, they've been here around the clock. I took his prints... It's him. Boy should be a teenager by now, but look at him. Explain to me how that can be.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I can't say, Sheriff. I'm just here to find out who took him.

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: I talked to everyone at school and no one saw him come back or how. The boy just come out of the blue.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Are those the case files?

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: Oh, yeah. Plenty more where those came from. There's lots of files. There's just not much in them. We never even had a suspect.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Have them set them over there, would you.

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: Set those on that table.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay. Well, what we've got here is a healthy seven-year-old boy who was born 17 years ago.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And a healthy boy who won't speak.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Excuse me? Are you finished with Billy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. and Mrs. Underwood?

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Um, you're with the FBI...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. I'm Agent Scully, and this is Agent Doggett. We are, uh, investigating this case.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: It's a miracle, isn't it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Underwood... whatever your son has been through, it has somehow affected his physical condition.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: So we've been told by every doctor here. We just want to take him home. After ten years, can we do that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Not yet. I want to talk to him first.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How you doing, Billy? My name's John. I'm gonna have a seat over here, is that okay? Is that all right?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Billy, I want you to know that you're not alone. I've talked to lots of other boys and girls who've been hurt just like you. Sometimes when they talk about it the hurt starts to go away. You want to talk about it, Billy?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, maybe you think bad things happened to you because you've been a bad boy... but I'm here to tell you, that's not true. The bad guy is the one who took you away and it's up to you and me to get the bad guy. See, 'cause as big and tough as I am, I can't do it alone. I need your help. Can you tell me about him, Billy? What's his name? What did he look like?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You remember this, don't you, Billy? Would you like to have that back?

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: What is he doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: All I want is his name.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Who the hell do you think you are? He's only a little boy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Underwood...?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think this is a game?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A serious game; one we have to win.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Have you really worked kid cases before, Agent Doggett? Child abductions?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I worked the child abduction task force. I know the horror stories, but this kid can help us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This isn't just a horror story. This is a biological impossibility.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, that's your area of expertise. I just want to put the person who did this out of business. Billy just didn't show up. He got away or was let go. And if he can talk, he can tell us by who. Or he can look at photos in the files and point to the man who did this so this doesn't happen to some other little boy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You are ignoring the fact that he is still seven years old.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Failure to thrive. Isn-isn't that the term? I mean, aren't there diseases that delay puberty and so on?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I told you... he's not sick.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Good. Then he can talk.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: We're home, honey. Safe at home.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: I'm going to go pay the sitter, Doug. You bring Billy in.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Are you glad to be home, Billy?

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: A lot's new here, son. You have a younger brother now. Josh. See that big dog out there with him? That's Sparky.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Would you like to go play with him?

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Sparky, stop it! Get down! What's gotten into you? Sparky! Sparky, hey! What's going on?

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Hey! Knock it off!

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: What's the matter, Doug?

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: I don't know. The dog just went off... Sparky, what is wrong with you? Come on, let's go.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Honey, it's all right. He just didn't recognize you, that's all. He's a nice dog, Sparky. He just doesn't realize that you're part of the family.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: But you are, Billy and we're just so glad that you're finally home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You going to sleep here, too?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What time is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I spoke with the doctors who treated Billy. I looked at his charts.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And what, did you find something?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes and no. What showed up is that Billy is the same boy who was taken ten years ago.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We know that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. I mean the –same- boy. He has no cavities. He has no tooth decay. He still has four baby teeth that he's never lost. He had a routine blood test six weeks before he disappeared in 1990. His cell counts, his enzymes, his hormone levels, they are all exactly the same as they were ten years ago.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Now how can that be possible?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's medically impossible.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So, what's the punch line? Where are you saying he's been?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There are … X-File cases that describe similar paranormal findings. Alien abductees who came back with anomalous medical stats.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know, these words: "Anomalous," "supernatural," "paranormal..." They purport to explain something by not explaining it. It's lazy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not saying that I can explain it, Agent Doggett, but this is definitely not normal.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I went back to the witnesses at the crime scene the day Billy vanished, to this guy, Ronald Purnell.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He was detained, questioned and dismissed as a suspect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's your interest in this guy?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: He's a high school dropout, convicted of possession, arson, and shoplifting since 1990.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These are juvenile records. These are sealed by the court, Agent Doggett. We're not supposed to have these.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And we're at a standstill here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, and you're breaking the law.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Look, I want to catch this guy, Agent Scully, whatever it takes.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: We love you so much, Billy. It's so good to have you back-- to be tucking you in. Sleep tight.

speaker: [CLOSED CAPTIONING ALSO HAD
line: nan

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: He's asleep.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Billy or Josh?

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Both, but I meant Billy.]

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Of course you did.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: What is that supposed to mean?

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: It means that you're blind to what's going on here, Lisa.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Ten years we prayed for this. Every night we prayed to God.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: I prayed for our son. That is not the boy I knew, Lisa.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: What do you expect him to be? They told us this will take time.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Even Josh is afraid of him.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: He is nothing to be afraid of.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: I wish I could believe that.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: How can you sit here and say these things to me? I thought this would make us both so happy.

speaker: [CLOSED CAPTIONING ALSO HAD
line: nan

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: We should have tried to get more answers. We were too quick to pull him out of the hospital.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: We weren't quick enough, Doug.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: For all we know he may need some kind of medical attention.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Don't try to make this sound like you're concerned for Billy. It's sickening.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: What I'm concerned about is this family. Something is wrong with him, Lisa.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: He is our son!]

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Anybody in there? Hello? Ronald Purnell?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Ronald Purnell?

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: Yeah.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can I talk to you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Can you come out, and we can have a conversation?

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: Is this about my probation?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's about a little boy named Billy Underwood. You know that name? Ring a bell?

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: No.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It does to everybody else in this area. He vanished from a school fair you were at ten years ago.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You remember him now?

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: Yeah. I remember him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You think he'd remember you?

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: Me?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You. Your face.

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: You're a trip, man. You know that?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This has nothing to do with you being stoned or violating your probation. All I'm asking is that we go see Billy. See what he says.

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: See what he says where?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where? Wherever. Wherever you want. I'll make sure he's there.

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: You're not making sense, Dude. Just leave me alone.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Billy? Honey, are you here?

speaker: JOSH
line: What?! What are you doing?!

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Joshey! Oh, my god! Are you hurt?

speaker: JOSH
line: No.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: You're bleeding.

speaker: JOSH
line: Mom!

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Where did that come from?

speaker: JOSH
line: I don't know.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Billy. Billy... Billy, honey... what are you doing here?

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Please, Billy, answer me.

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: Just got word back from the lab. Ran the blood twice and no doubt about it. It's the little boy's.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: But I thought you said he wasn't cut.

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: No. You're misunderstanding. It's the other son I'm talking about, Billy-- the boy who was kidnapped.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: That doesn't make any sense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Billy wasn't cut either.

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: No, but he definitely handled the knife. His prints are on it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where did he even get it?

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: His father's never seen it before. He's no hunter. Never cleaned an animal, which is about all a knife like that's good for... except for killing, of course.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I hate to say this … but I think that the best thing for Billy and his family is if he's removed to an institution under the observation of people who are experienced in these things.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You mean, remove him? Take him away? After all his family's been through?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is not a normal child, Agent Doggett, and this is not a normal act.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You make it sound like he's possessed. Call the exorcist. He's a kid-- a kid who's been through who knows what kind of hell. Give him a chance. How do you know he's not trying to communicate something?

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what's the message?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, he's a kid, Agent Doggett, you're right. He's a kid who materialized out of thin air, unaged. Do you not somehow recognize how strange this is?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Did anybody notice this? This symbol?

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: Yeah. Yeah, uh, I was going to mention that to you 'cause it's... uh …kind of weird.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Weird how?

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: Well, like I told you, we tried everything to find that boy, and who abducted him went so far as to bring in a police psychic ten years back-- came up with that very same symbol.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, how exactly did he come up with it?

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: She. Sharon Pearl. Couldn't say how it came to her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've seen this symbol before, too.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You have?

speaker: SHERIFF SANCHEZ
line: I'll be damned.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: We love you so much, Billy. Whatever happened... we want to put it behind us. Be a family again. And if you could help us to understand what you're going through, we could move forward.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: No, we're just going to go see a doctor, someone you might want to talk to. We're coming right back.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Nothing's going to happen. Mommy won't let anything happen to you.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Billy, I just want you to get the help you need so we can all live here together and be happy. Okay? Come on, sweetie.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: I'll take him, Doug. If it's such a strain on you.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Look, if you think a shrink can give us some answers, fine. I just don't want this to ruin our other son's life in any way.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Billy? Billy?

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Where's Billy?

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: Billy?

speaker: JOSH
line: Dad!

speaker: MARCIA PURNELL
line: I don't want no more trouble here, Ronnie. Whatever you're doing, you do it somewhere else.

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: You ever get off your lazy ass to do anything but hassle me?!

speaker: MARCIA PURNELL
line: Watch your mouth. I got company coming and he won't take your lip.

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: Who?

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: You tell him to stay out of my face.

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: Get away from me.

speaker: CAL JEPPY
line: Where you going, weirdo? Hey. Hey. You steal those clothes off a fat man.? Or'd... you just shrink? Hmm?

speaker: MARCIA PURNELL
line: Hey, you going to get your butt in this trailer, traveling man?

speaker: CAL JEPPY
line: Yeah. All depends on, uh... what you've got in mind. Hmm?

speaker: BOTH
line: Mmm.

speaker: SHARON PEARL
line: Testing, one, two, three...

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: This is great. Now, I've got a psychic sitting in my living room who's going to tell me what's wrong with my son.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I understand your misgivings, Mr. Underwood, but perhaps you can look at this as just another avenue.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: An avenue to what?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We're going to solve this case, Mr. Underwood. We're going to find out who did this to your son.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: And then what? What am I left with? A kid who stabs knives into his brother's mattress? You don't know the half of it. He gives everyone but his mother the creeps with that stare of his.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I just know that this is going to tear you apart. It's going to tear your family apart. And you can't let it. You've got to save them from the damage this can do.

speaker: DOUG UNDERWOOD
line: I'll be happy to save what I can. Come on, Josh. Let's go.

speaker: SHARON PEARL
line: Is this going to happen?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Shouldn't you be telling us that?

speaker: SHARON PEARL
line: You're no doubt confused, Agent Doggett. I take psychic readings not see through walls.

speaker: LISA UNDERWOOD
line: Sorry to keep you waiting.

speaker: SHARON PEARL
line: Mrs. Underwood. I'm Sharon Pearl. I consulted on your son's disappearance back in 1990.

speaker: SHARON PEARL
line: And you're Billy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ms. Pearl? Are you okay?

speaker: SHARON PEARL
line: There are very powerful forces at work here. Working through this boy. Drawing him to his brother. I feel this force...

speaker: SHARON PEARL
line: I feel this force...

speaker: SHARON PEARL
line: … coming through you. You lost someone just like Billy.

line: SCULLY: Call 9-1-1.]

line: What's happening to her?

line: She's having a grand mal seizure.]

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my god.

speaker: CAL JEPPY
line: Hey, Fartknocker.

line: Where are you going in such a big hurry? Hmm? What's the matter? Got something in your ears?

speaker: RONNIE PURNELL
line: Don't .. don't touch me, Cal.

speaker: CAL JEPPY
line: Oh, listen to him. No wonder he wears them baggy britches. Our Ronnie's a big man now.

line: Your old lady said the cops came and talked to you. Hmm?

line: I am talking to you, not the side of your head. Better mind your Ps and Qs, Jones. Or I'm going to tell them what you did to that little boy. I'm going to tell them what you got buried out there in the woods.

line: What's going on with you two?

speaker: CAL JEPPY
line: Talking about cars.

line: Well, they've got her stabilized and it looks like she's going to be okay... if you're at all curious about her condition.

line: He's in the woods!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Watch your fire! There may be another boy!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Down on your knees!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hands in the air! Where's the kid?!

speaker: CAL JEPPY
line: He's in the trailer.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Other kid!

speaker: CAL JEPPY
line: There's no other kid.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Billy Underwood!

speaker: CAL JEPPY
line: There's no other kid.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Get this man in cuffs! Read him his rights! The kid's over...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't believe it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay, the clothes, the age and condition of the bones, the location of the grave. There is no doubt that that is Billy Underwood's skeleton that is in that grave.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We spent time with this boy. Doctors took Billy's blood. You examined him yourself. Now, I can't accept it. I can't believe we're asking them to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know, but the forensic evidence is going to come out, and what then? What if I'm right?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, what then, Agent Scully? What we do? We move on, let it go, case closed?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I know where you are with this. I have been there. I know what you're feeling-- that you've failed and that you have to explain this somehow. And maybe you can.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Not if that's Billy's body, I can't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But maybe that's explanation enough. That that's not Billy's brother lying in that grave, too. That that man who did this is never going to be able to do it again. Isn't that what you wanted, Agent Doggett?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Agent Scully, don't ask me to believe that this is some kind of justice from beyond the grave.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All I'm saying is that maybe you succeeded... whether you're willing to see that or not. ALL THE PRETTY LITTLE HORSES Hush-a-bye, don't you cry Go to sleep my little baby. When you wake, you shall have All the pretty little horses. Dapples and Grays Pintos and Bays All the pretty little horses Way out yonder, down in the meadow Poor little baby crying, "Mama." Birds and butterflies, flutter round your eyes Poor little baby crying, "Mama." Hush-a-bye, don't you cry Go to sleep my little baby. When you wake, you shall have All the pretty little horses. Dapples and Grays Pintos and Bays All the pretty little horses.
